rComments: Stay away from this prof if you can! He reads off his slides. He is full of himself. He expects us to get the ratios from the cases and doesn't explain complicated principles. He doesn't use a textbook, just a casebook so get ready to search the library for useful textbooks to help explain what he didn't... overall terrible prof

Clear lectures, formulaic building of knowledge. No surprises on tests. Respects opinions that differ from his own and gives credit accordingly. No expensive text to buy. Invested in students' success.
Lecture are ok, but not brilliant. Slides are very helpful, as are tutorials.  Smart, passionate about contracts, funny, very expert. Hated closed book exam.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Smart, well able to elaborate on concepts. As someone else has mentioned, he is not the most effective lecturer (speaks softly sometimes; has strong accent), but presents with such intelligence and wit that lectures are good. Slides are very helpful. Does closed book exams - not so great.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Not the most effective or engaging lecturer-his lectures can be really dry. Most material is learned thru self-study and his slides which are quite  useful. Not particularly helpful or encouraging during office hours. His exam fact patterns are especially difficult  because they're closed book. Overall, nice guy but wouldn't be my first choice.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Hilarious']

rComments: I loved Chidi as a contracts prof. He did go over in detail each case, but left the synthesis to the students. It was a 100% exam course over the full year ( so 50% first semester and 50% second) In my upper years, I've come to know and read some of his work on International Indigenous law and am super impressed and thankful for him and his work!
Really clear and thorough explanation of the concepts. Textbook readings are hard. Excellent powerpoint slides. Lectures are clear and fun.

I went into contracts (2013-2014) dreading it; it ended up being my favourite class in law school, thanks to Chidi.  His explanations were clear and on point.  Go to class; pay attention to the lectures and his summaries of the key case components/principles.   Although I was nervous about his closed book exam, I ended up doing extremely well.
